item.title: Evolution of Single Sign On
item.description: Single sign on is a very common requirement for organizations with many employees. Once you reach a certain stage and new employees are onboarded regularly, you need a smooth process for this. Similarly, employee churn becomes an ordinary event, and you have to make sure that people that do not work for the company anymore are taken out from your user database and their accesses revoked. Before the advent of SSO (or LDAP/AD), users were created and managed on the various systems separately.
